title: Threads
subject: Operating Systems
theory:
A thread is a basic unit of CPU utilization. A process can have multiple threads. 
- **Shared**: Code, Data, Files (Heap).
- **Private**: Registers, Stack, PC.
Switching threads is faster than switching processes.

examples.code:
Web Server:
1 Process listening on port 80.
spawns 1 Thread per incoming request.

common_mistakes.correction: No. Each thread needs its own function (call) stack.
